reviews.text: The location here is the main advantage, as it is a stones throw to the plaza de armas, restaurants and sights. The breakfast isn't worth getting up for. There was a plumbing problem in our ensuite which leaked and had quite a bad smell. We were provided with extra towels and a bucket to keep it under control and were offered a different room but as it had only twin beds we decided to stay put. Otherwise it was a comfortable and pleasant stay. Staff are helpful and booked bus tickets for us.
reviews.title: Great location, poor breakfasts

reviews.text: PS - if visiting Arequipa, eating in Zig Zag is a must!
reviews.title: Great Hostal
Excellent service and value for money
reviews.text: I spent 3 weeks here and it was great. Staff very helpful, rooms are very clean, its the best place I have stayed in, in the 3 months I have been in Peru. Hot water and wifi were good and the kitchen area with tv was a great place to hang out and meet new people. I also went to the Spanish school that is behind the hostal and loved to spend the afternoons on the roof terrace doing my homework.

I stayed at Los Andes for several days. The rooms were very clean and pleasant and the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The price was very reasonable. I would highly recommend it to anyone traveling to Arequipa.
reviews.title: Excellent location
Great location, friendly hotel
reviews.text: The best location you could find in Arequipa. Clean, huge rooms, very friendly and helpful staff. Simple, but good breakfast. The taxi driver tried to convince us that it`s very expensive, but it`s not true. I booked the rooms in advance, so I knew how much I`ll pay for it. It was the normal price, like everywhere in Peru for a backpacker hostel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: I'd Recomend

reviews.text: +Large, nice rooms. Very spacious.
reviews.title: Good, Confortable,Close

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: +Super comfy beds and pillows
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: +Great location! Just at Plaza Del Armas.
reviews.title: Good location, helpful staff

reviews.text: + Staff has been nice
reviews.title: Good value, but I wouldn't rely on included breakfast.

reviews.text: 150 Meters south of the Plaza de Armas located. A nice retreat, big rooms including breakfast, friendly staff, free Tea all day. Booked 4 rooms, all came with a bath, hot shower. At the reception is also a small travel agency, from which you can book further hotels, tours and buses.
reviews.title: Excellent stay in Arequipa

reviews.text: I stayed here on and off for three weeks while taking classes at EDEAQ language school, which is in the same building. For the budget it really is a perfect option, the location is half a block from the Plaza de Armas. Breakfast is bread, butter, jam, fresh juice, coffee and tea. It doesn´t sound like much, but it´s the Peruvian standard for continental breakfast.
reviews.title: Recommended

reviews.text: The kitchen is nice and they do try and keep it clean.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.text: Alex, the travel agent, was super helpful in setting up my Colca Canyon tour.
reviews.title: Crazy not to

reviews.text: The only reason I give it four stars is between the hallway lights and street lights, my room never got dark and it was super noisy. Ask for a room on the third floor! And on a sad note, I put some semi-expensive leftovers in the fridge Sunday afternoon and they were thrown out Monday morning, without any notice! If you are traveling on a budget you might understand how devastating this was for me! :)
reviews.title: Definitely recommend

reviews.text: Wow, could it be? A Lonely Planet-listed property that still offers great value accommodation after appearing in the infamous travel bible? Yup, this is a good spot.
reviews.title: Lonely Planet actually nails it...for once.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly and reliable staff, hot showers with great water pressure, prodigious common space with -- by Peruvian standards -- reliable and fast WIFI, fresh juice at breakfast, clean and spacious rooms with comfortable beds and spotless linens.
reviews.title: cant beat the location of this BnB

reviews.text: Oh, and a location just 15 seconds from the main square. Great place!
reviews.title: Pretty Much Perfect

reviews.text: stayed here before and after our colca caynon trek, we paid 55sol for a double with shared bathroom. hotel is very clean and provided towel foc. the staff seemed friendly enough but i couldnt always understand them, seeing as they have a language school attached i would have thought they would be able to speak good english. when asking about bus times to cabanaconde the guy didnt really help us, probably because we werent booking a trip with him so no commision. the breakfast is a let down just the same rock hard bread with jam and tea. hardly a worth while included breakfast. overall, nice quiet room (if a little expensive for without a bathroom) with an excellent location but breakfast was crap and staff not brilliant.
reviews.title: Cannot fault Los Andes in any way...

reviews.text: Prob the best city hostel I've ever stayed in. Location couldn't be better, literally a stone's throw from Plaza de Armas. It's big, old building, stone built and hence very quiet, I couldn't hear a thing from my room, which was immaculate with the comfiest bed and best quality pillows and sheets I've ever come across travelling in South America.
reviews.title: Really good value and location
